danish_publication: Der var en enke, som en biskop havde frataget alle hendes ejendomme. Hendes sön havde været udenlands, og da han kom hjem tillige med en anden mand, så satte enken mad på bordet for dem. Men det vigtigste til maden manglede, og det var brød. Da sönnen spurgte om grunden dertil, sagde moderen, at brødet havde biskoppen taget, og der kunde de hente det. Sönnen og den fremmede mand red derpå hen og hævnede det på bispen ved at myrde ham i Hvidbjærg kirke.
english_publication: A bishop had confiscated all the property from a widow. Her son had been abroad, and when he came home along with another man, the widow put food on the table for them. But the most important part of the meal was missing, and that was the bread. When the son asked the reason why, the mother said that the bread had been taken by the bishop, and they could go get it there. The son and the stranger then rode over there and avenged themselves on the bishop by murdering him in Hvidbjærg church.
